list_definition.definition: an artificial covering of hair for the head

list_ex_of_english: The issue of whether wigs and gowns should be worn is secondary to what is happening in the legal profession.
Included in the closing ceremony were twelve aerialists in bright striped lycra costumes with large wigs, turning and balancing, ascending and descending, on six large, purpose-built aerial rings.
But for the last scene they had a very good way of releasing feeling because these young women just took off their wigs, and their natural hair revealed their individuality.
We can obtain dentures if we lose our teeth, and wigs if we lose our hair.
For older men who are completely bald and perhaps show their age, a wig helps them look younger and is a great leveller.
The fibers may have been part of headdresses, wigs, mantas, or mats the individuals wore or sat on, again signifying their authority.
This was about the wearing of wigs and gowns.
A lace napkin, edged with pearls, perches precariously on top of a black wig, while on his feet he wears a pair of fluffy pink slippers.
